meanings.definition: A protein found in wheat and other grains, responsible for the elastic texture of dough.
meanings.sent1: The baker added gliadin to the dough to make it stretchy.
meanings.sent2: When baking bread, gliadin helps give the dough its flexibility.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous dough decided to play a prank by hiding all the gliadin.
meanings.sent4: The gliadin in the dough was like the secret ingredient that made it perfect.
meanings.sent5: The gliadin in the dough was like the magic that made it easy to shape.

meanings.definition: A type of gluten protein that can trigger an immune response in individuals with celiac disease.
meanings.sent1: Individuals with celiac disease need to avoid foods containing gliadin.
meanings.sent2: Gliadin can cause discomfort for those with celiac disease.
meanings.sent3: The sneaky gliadin tried to cause trouble in the celiac patient's meal.
meanings.sent4: For someone with celiac disease, gliadin is like a harmful invader in the body.
meanings.sent5: The immune system sees gliadin as an unwelcome guest in the body.
